required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Interest of Medial Partial Arthrodesis in Degenerative and Inflammatory Damage of Lisfranc Tarsometatarsal Joint.
clinical_study.official_title: Interest of Medial Partial Arthrodesis in Degenerative and Inflammatory Damage of Lisfranc Tarsometatarsal Joint.

brief_summary.textblock:
Research Hypothesis: Lisfranc tarsometatarsal joint arthrodesis is a reliable surgical procedure, allowing the restoration of satisfactory function and a painless foot with an acceptable complication rate.
Objective of the study: To analyze the clinical and radiographic results in the medium term of arthrodesis of the Lisfranc tarsometatarsal joint in cases of primary osteoarthritis, post-traumatic osteoarthritis or in cases of inflammatory pathology.

detailed_description.textblock:
Data collection by return to the patient record:
- Clinical score
- Analysis of imagery (X-rays, CT scan, )
The patients included were those who had undergone arthrodesis of the medial Lisfranc joint

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical improvement of the AOFAS score of the midfoot

arm_group.description: Population who underwent a surgical arthrodesis procedure for arthritic or inflammatory involvement of the Lisfranc tarsometatarsal joint

study_pop.textblock: All patients who underwent Lisfranc arthrodesis for primary post-traumatic osteoarthritis or inflammatory disease between January 2008 and December 2020 in the department of orthopeadic surgery of the CHU NANCY

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients who underwent Lisfranc arthrodesis for primary post-traumatic osteoarthritis or inflammatory disease between January 2008 and December 2020 in
- Age > 18 ans
Exclusion Criteria:
- Follow-up < 6 months
- Lost to follow-up
- lack of data in the patient record.
